Wisdom: الْمَكَانَةُ مِنَ الْمُلُوكِ مِفْتَاحُ الْمِحْنَةِ وَبَذْرُ الْفِتْنَةِ
enWisdom: Holding a post with kings is a key of tribulation and the seed of affliction

Wisdom: اصْحَبِ السُّلْطَانَ بِالْحَذَرِ وَالصَّدِيقَ بِالتَّوَاضُعِ وَالْبِشْرِ وَالْعَدُوَّ بِمَا تَقُومُ بِهِ عَلَيْهِ حُجَّتُكَ
enWisdom: Accompany the ruler with caution, the friend with humility and cheerfulness, and the enemy with that which you can [use to] establish your proof over him

Wisdom: صَاحِبُ السُّلْطَانِ كَرَاكِبِ الْأَسَدِ يُغْبَطُ بِمَوْقِفِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْرَفُ بِمَوْضِعِهِ
enWisdom: The king’s courtier is like a person who is riding on a lion, people are envious of his status while he is more aware of his own [dangerous] position

Wisdom: لَا تُكْثِرَنَّ الدُّخُولَ عَلَى الْمُلُوكِ فَإِنَّهُمْ إِنْ صَحِبْتَهُمْ مَلُّوكَ وَإِنْ نَصَحْتَهُمْ غَشُّوكَ
enWisdom: Never visit kings frequently, for they are such that if you accompany them they will become weary of you and if you advise them sincerely they will debase you

Wisdom: لَا تَرْغَبْ فِي خُلْطَةِ الْمُلُوكِ فَإِنَّهُمْ يَسْتَكْثِرُونَ مِنَ الْكَلَامِ رَدَّ السَّلَامِ وَيَسْتَقِلُّونَ مِنَ الْعِقَابِ ضَرْبَ الرِّقَابِ
enWisdom: Do not desire to mingle with kings, for indeed they consider replying salutations to be too much speech and striking the necks to be insignificant punishment

Wisdom: لَا تَطْمَعَنَّ فِي مَوَدَّةِ الْمُلُوكِ فَإِنَّهُمْ يُوحِشُونَكَ آنَسَ مَا تَكُونُ بِهِمْ وَيَقْطَعُونَكَ أَقْرَبَ مَا تَكُونُ إِلَيْهِمْ
enWisdom: Never desire to gain the affection of kings, for indeed they will forsake you when you are most intimate with them and they will cut you off when you are closest to them

Wisdom: رَغْبَتُكَ فِي زَاهِدٍ فِيكَ ذُلٌّ
enWisdom: Your longing for the one who has no interest in you is a humiliation

Wisdom: لُزُومُ الْكَرِيمِ عَلَى الْهَوَانِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ صُحْبَةِ اللَّئِيمِ عَلَى الْإِحْسَانِ
enWisdom: Remaining alongside a noble-minded person in humiliation is better than accompanying the wicked in order to gain favour

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ خُلْطَتُهُ قَلَّتْ تَقِيَّتُهُ
enWisdom: One whose social interaction increases, his piety (or reliability) decreases

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَتْ زِيَارَتُهُ قَلَّتْ بَشَاشَتُهُ
enWisdom: One whose visits increase, his cheerfulness decreases

Wisdom: مَنْ خَالَطَ النَّاسَ قَلَّ وَرَعُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever mingles with the people, his piety decreases?

Wisdom: مَنْ خَالَطَ النَّاسَ نَالَهُ مَكْرُهُمْ
enWisdom: One who mingles with the people is affected by their devices

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَصْحَبْكَ مُعِيناً عَلَى نَفْسِكَ‏ فَصُحْبَتُهُ وَبَالٌ عَلَيْكَ إِنْ عَلِمْتَ
enWisdom: One who does not assist you by [his] accompanying you, then his company is [actually] a burden on you, if [only] you knew

Wisdom: مُبَايَنَةُ الدَّنَايَا تَكْبِتُ الْعَدُوَّ
enWisdom: Disassociating oneself from loathsome actions and traits subdues the enemy

Wisdom: مُجَالَسَةُ الْعَوَامِّ تُفْسِدُ الْعَادَةَ [الْعِبَادَةَ]
enWisdom: Sitting with the common people corrupts one’s habits

Wisdom: مُجَالَسَةُ أَبْنَاءِ الدُّنْيَا مَنْسَاةٌ لِلْإِيمَانِ قَائِدَةٌ إِلَى طَاعَةِ الشَّيْطَانِ
enWisdom: Drowning he will still not be saved from the fear [of drowning]

Wisdom: لَا تُطِيعُوا الْأَدْعِيَاءَ الَّذِينَ شَرِبْتُمُ بِصَفْوِكُمْ كَدَرَهُمْ وَخَلَطْتُمْ بِصِحَّتِكُمْ مَرَضَهُمْ وَأَدْخَلْتُمْ فِي حَقِّكُمْ بَاطِلَهُمْ
enWisdom: Do not follow the claimants [of Islam] whose dirty water you drink along with your clean one, whose sicknesses you mix with your health and whose falsehood you allow to enter into your rightful matters

Wisdom: لَا تَصْحَبَنَّ أَبْنَاءَ الدُّنْيَا فَإِنَّكَ إِنْ أَقْلَلْتَ اسْتَثْقَلُوكَ وَإِنْ أَكْثَرْتَ حَسَدُوكَ
enWisdom: Do not associate with those who love this world, for if you have less they will disregard you and if you have more they will envy you

Wisdom: لَا تَصْحَبْ مَنْ فَاتَهُ الْعَقْلُ وَلَا تَصْطَنِعْ مَنْ خَانَهُ الْأَصْلُ فَإِنَّ مَنْ لَا عَقْلَ لَهُ يَضُرُّكَ مِنْ حَيْثُ يَرَى أَنَّهُ يَنْفَعُكَ وَمَنْ لَا أَصْلَ لَهُ يُسِي‏ءُ إِلَى مَنْ يُحْسِنُ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Do not accompany the one who has lost his mind and do not seek good from one who is betrayed by his roots, for the one who is insane will harm you while he thinks he is helping you and the one who does not have [virtuous] roots will do evil to the one who does good to him

Wisdom: لَا تَحْلُوا مُصَاحَبَةُ غَيْرِ أَرِيبٍ
enWisdom: The companionship of the unintelligent is not enjoyable

Wisdom: لَا تَصْفُو الْخُلَّةُ مَعَ غَيْرِ أَدِيبٍ
enWisdom: Friendship does not become pure [and sincere] with one who is not well-mannered

Wisdom: لَا خَيْرَ فِي مُعِينٍ مُهِينٍ
enWisdom: There is no good in a helper who humiliates

Wisdom: رُبَّ وَاثِقٍ خَجِلٌ
enWisdom: Many a person who relies on something [or someone] gets ashamed

Wisdom: مَنْ دَخَلَ مَدَاخِلَ السَّوْءِ اتُّهِمَ
enWisdom: One who enters into a place of evil is [suspected and] accused

Wisdom: مَنْ سَاءَ اخْتِيَارُهُ قَبُحَتْ آثَارُهُ
enWisdom: One whose choice is bad, his results become ugly

Wisdom: مَنْ قَرُبَ مِنَ الدَّنِيَّةِ اتُّهِمَ
enWisdom: One who comes near the despicable is accused
